title: 1964–65 William & Mary Indians men's basketball team
text:
The 1964–65 <a href="William%20%26amp%3B%20Mary%20Indians%20men%27s%20basketball">William & Mary Indians men's basketball</a> team represented the <a href="College%20of%20William%20%26amp%3B%20Mary">College of William & Mary</a> in <a href="college%20basketball">intercollegiate</a> <a href="basketball">basketball</a> during the <a href="1964%E2%80%9365%20NCAA%20University%20Division%20men%27s%20basketball%20season">1964–65 NCAA University Division men's basketball season</a>. Under the eighth year of head coach <a href="Bill%20Chambers%20%28basketball%29">Bill Chambers</a>, the team finished the season 12–13 and 6–8 in the Southern Conference.
William & Mary played most of its home games on campus at <a href="Blow%20Gymnasium">Blow Gymnasium</a>, with one home game played off campus at the <a href="Norfolk%20Municipal%20Auditorium">Norfolk Municipal Auditorium</a> in <a href="Norfolk%2C%20Virginia">Norfolk, Virginia</a>. This was the 60th season of the collegiate basketball program at William & Mary, whose nickname is now the Tribe.
The Indians finished in sixth place in the conference and qualified for the <a href="1965%20Southern%20Conference%20Men%27s%20Basketball%20Tournament">1965 Southern Conference Men's Basketball Tournament</a>, held at the <a href="Bojangles%27%20Coliseum">Charlotte Coliseum</a> in <a href="Charlotte%2C%20North%20Carolina">Charlotte, North Carolina</a>. William & Mary defeated <a href="The%20Citadel%20Bulldogs%20men%27s%20basketball">The Citadel</a> in the first round and <a href="Virginia%20Tech%20Hokies%20men%27s%20basketball">VPI</a> in the second round before falling, in double overtime, to fourth-seeded <a href="West%20Virginia%20Mountaineers%20men%27s%20basketball">West Virginia</a> in the championship game (67–70).
The Indians did not participate in a post-season tournament.
